name: NSButton.GradientType
desc: Specify the gradients used by the gradientType property.

items.name: case none
items.desc: There is no gradient, so the button looks flat.

items.name: case concaveWeak
items.desc: The top-left corner is light gray, and the bottom-right corner is dark gray, so the button appears to be pushed in.

items.name: case concaveStrong
items.desc: As with NSGradientConcaveWeak, the top-left corner is light gray, and the bottom-right corner is dark gray, but the difference between the grays is greater, so the appearance of being pushed in is stronger.

items.name: case convexWeak
items.desc: The top-left corner is dark gray, and the bottom-right corner is light gray, so the button appears to be sticking out.

items.name: case convexStrong
items.desc: As with NSGradientConvexWeak, the top-left corner is dark gray, and the bottom-right corner is light gray, but the difference between the grays is greater, so the appearance of sticking out is stronger.
